alert.note: Alert for Pine (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 15 at 12:01PM CDT until April 20 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Snake River near Pine City affecting Pine County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota...Wisconsin... Mississippi River at Fort Ripley affecting Crow Wing and Morrison Counties. Mississippi River at Aitkin affecting Crow Wing and Aitkin Counties. St. Croix River at Danbury affecting Burnett and Pine Counties. .Heavy rain on top of the existing snowpack will increase the rate of snowmelt. The resultant runoff will cause water levels in area rivers to increase and flooding is expected. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Snake River near Pine City. * WHEN...From Sunday afternoon to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.5 feet, A few of the lowest dwellings adjacent to the Snake River, Cross Lake and Pokegama Lake need protection from flood waters. At 9.0 feet, This will cause flooding near Cross Lake near Pine City. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 8.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 9.4 feet Monday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.6 feet on 04/18/1965. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood . && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Snake River Pine City 9.0 8.4 Sat 11 am CD 9.0 9.3 9.4 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/duluth. The next statement will be issued late tonight by 1200 AM CDT.
